intro: Boehmeria dolichostachya var. mollis, commonly known as silky flax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its soft, silky leaves. The plant produces long, drooping clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous stalks have been historically used for textile purposes, similar to other members of the Boehmeria genus.
